Reviews.Title: My 5th Sharp LCD TV. Didn't Think I'd Buy Another...
Reviews.Author: JOHN
Reviews.Content: I already own 4 Sharp LCD TV's. This TV is to replace my bedroom 37" Sharp LCD that is about 6 years old (still works great, but will be putting it in my kids' playroom).So, after looking around at all the different brands I decided once again to buy a Sharp, the LC-40LE810UN. Reading about all the nice features of this unit, including the introduction of the new color (yellow) technology is what did it for me.After 1 week of using my new TV I am happy to report I made a great choice picking this unit. I explain the main points why:*  LED technology provides cleaner, brighter lighting. This is apparent as soon as you turn on the TV. As this unit is edge lit, not sure I see a difference between it, or a back lit LED unit. Need more time to evaluate this I guess.* Adding yellow as a fourth color is definitely noticeable, and I like it. As most people know plasma TV's give you better color than LCD TV's. My Panasonic plasma TV is proof of this. However, I believe the LC-40LE810UN is a step up in LCD technology that brings it closer to plasma-like colors.* Overall picture quality is excellent.* The speakers are great, clear and loud. To me this is a major improvement for Sharp as their speakers are always horrible (like on the other Sharp units I have).* The picture and sound adjustment options are plentiful and easy to use. This has always been the case with every Sharp TV I've owned. This one is slightly better/more user friendly.* The unit is very well built and elegant looking, especially the glass base.In closing, I am definitely recommending the LC-40LE810UN to all. You'll really like it!

Reviews.Title: Best HDTV for Gaming
Reviews.Author: jomojomo
Reviews.Content: We bought this one for the following reasons:1) Only LG and Sharp make all of their panels in house.  Sony, Samsung, etc all farm some of their production out to subcontractors.  And you cant tell by the model number, as in some instances, the same model will have two different panels; and the purchaser wont know until they get it home and their tv looks 10 times worse than the display model in the store.  It's called the panel lottery, and I did not want any part of that.  I also found out that Sony makes none of their panels anymore; 40% of Sony TVs are made by Samsung, 50% a Chinese company called AUO (iirc), and 10% by Sharp.  The Sharp the panels are only in Sony's top of line tvs, btw.2) We did not want 3D.  We both think 3D tv looks terrible, and is a waste of money.  Especially given the fact that Sharp's Aquos 3d tvs are $3,000 and up.3) LCD is required as this was going to be used gaming, and I don't want to have to worry about burn in with a plasma.  We have a plasma for movies and we love it, but I prefere LCD for gaming.4)The panel is cutting edge.  The panel is made in a state of the art facility in Japan.  It is a UV2A, 4 primary color panel, and imo, has the best picture of any tv currently made.  We spend more than a few nights trolling retailers, and the Aquos was always the best looking TV.5) Price.  We bought ours for $1199 with a 4 year extended warranty, unbelievable value.A couple of notes that you should keep in mind though.  It doesn't come wifi ready.  You can hook up an Ethernet cable out of the box, but if you want wifi you'll need a $75 bridge.  And if you have a wii, you'll need to get an adapter cable.  Although the panel is made in Japan, the final assembly does happen in other countries.  Ours was assembled in Mexico.  And finally, color accuracy is a problem with this model, but for video games it doesn't matter a whole lot.

Reviews.Title: Better than Samsung un32c6500
Reviews.Author: sagrc18
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality.  The Quattron really does create better colors.  I got a 32 inch samsung un32c6500 from HHGregg before I returned it for this Sharp.  They let me have the samsung for $975 plus tax, and when I explained how TERRIBLE the backlight bleeding was on the samsung, the guy let me trade it for this 40 inch Sharp led tv straight up, which was awesome.  There is ZERO backlight bleeding on this Sharp (at least on the one I got).  The picture is fantastic and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great LED tv.  Even though it is and edge-lit led, it has no backlight bleeding...so rare.  I'm lucky!

Reviews.Title: This TV Rocks. Seriously.
Reviews.Author: Tommy
Reviews.Content: I have been toying with the idea of buying my first HD TV for a while. I have been going into places like Sears, Best Buy, ABC Warehouse, and Paul's TV for the last couple of weeks. I also have been checking out the prices and reading reviews on sites like Amazon. I finally thought I settled on either a Samsung UN40C6300 or a Sharp LC40LE830U. Both were $899 at the Paul's TV I looked. For the second time, I went into Sears  to check out the sales. I wanted LED (for the longer lasting bulbs and power savings value), a great picture, a reasonable price, and possibly a full array set if I could find one in my price range.I had no intent on buying today. I had two friends with me. Both friends and myself thought the picture quality looked significantly better on the Sharp TVs. Further, as a design major, I appreciated the overall aesthetic look of the Sharp as well. The glass panel and stand are very sharp (no pun intended). The Samsung wasn't bad looking, it just wasn't as nice as the Sharp. The TV really pops in my living room.There was no 40 inch Sharp on display other then a clearance model that was being sold for $799. I thought about buying it, and the sales guy came back with a flyer a few minutes after asking him questions about the floor model. He pointed out that a brand new model was going for $699 until the next day. After using my iPhone to check prices online, I jumped on it as I couldn't find it cheaper anywhere (which surprised me as Amazon and Paul's TV had the better prices before when I was checking ( Sears will beat an advertised price though)).First, the TV was super light. Although the box was bulky, I carried it in the house myself easily. The Samsung 27 inch CRT it was replacing weighed a ton. Attaching the TV to the stand was a matter of screwing in nine screws. Again, I needed no help (although one or two of the screws fought me a bit). What I appreciated was Sharp used regular Philip head screws so I could use my own tools to get this done. The job took about five minutes.Second, after the Sears guy told me I needed a HDMI cable to hook the TV up to the X-Box, I bought one. Turns out, the traditional X-Box cable would have worked saving me thirty dollars. I 'd like to think the sales guy was just trying to be helpful, but I am skeptical as he tried to sell me cleaner and an additional warranty all at the same time. I played a few games of Splinter Cell and Kinect Sports. It is like playing the two games for the first time. The graphics are amazingly crisp. I almost didn't recognize Splinter Cell. It was so awesome.  For built in TV speakers, the sound is very good. They certainly beat the speakers in the Samsung CRT it was replacing. If I want better, I will invest in sound system.Third, I also like that the TV swivels very easily (45 degrees each direction). I am unsure if the Samsung's swivel or not. I tried them at the store and if they did it wasn't without effort. I was afraid to force the issue. The swiveling is nice because I have a small living room where to play Kinect I 'd sometimes have to move furniture to get decent playing area. With the Sharp, I can just swivel the TV, which opens up more play space.Fourth, I ditched cable so I didn't' hook the TV up to that. I watch Netflix, Hulu Plus, and DVDs. Netflix and Hulu Plus never looked better. I also streamed music, movies, and photos from my Mac to the TV through the X-Box. The TV is supposed to do this natively, but I haven't tried it. Turns out to use the Internet features, you need either an extra wi-fi adapter or an ethernet hook up. I had neither. This wasn't really a big deal for me, as most of these features were duplicated through the X-Box, which was working via wifi. My photos taken from my Canon S90 looked real.Fifth, I was trying to avoid edge lighting and go with full array for the backlighting. I read the Sharp TVs use full array. Maybe some do, but this one apparently does not. I read on the Internet otherwise, but there it was on the box (which I discovered at home). Nonetheless, I haven't experienced the problem some of the Samsung's experience with the edge lighting (uneven color). Perhaps, Sharp uses a different implementation of edge lighting for the backlighting then Samsung. I don't know, it just looks great.Finally, I read Samsung outsources most of its panels. Supposedly, you can read some codes to figure out if the TV you are buying has a Samsung panel. I didn't want to bother. Sharp makes its own so I didn't have to worry about a TV looking different at the store then at home. Again, it didn't seem to be a contest in terms of picture quality even at the store. This TV is amazing.Ok, I lied. two last things. The remote is pretty confusing. I mostly, use the X-Box controller, so that isn't much of an issue for me. There is a zillion buttons though. My friend bought a Vizio online. He was so excited until he found the dead pixel dead center. This TV didn't have that problem. No dead or stuck pixels.Update: I have had the TV for close to three weeks now. I am still extremely happy with it. I find the menu system very easy to use, and it works great with my X-Box, which I use as a digital hub to connect with my Mac and to use services like Netflix and Hulu. The one question I was primarily concerned with is that this TV, like most LED TVs, is an edge lighting model as opposed to a full array set. Full array sets are supposed to be superior because they spread the lights used for the back lighting across the whole panel, whereas edge lighting models place the lightening only along the edges. This light is then reflected across the panel using a mirrored back. Some people with other sets, and at least one commenter for this set, have suggested you can see the lights along the edge of the edge lightening sets when watching content that contains a lot of black. Not to devalue these experiences, but I have not noticed this effect and I have been consciously looking for it.Update 11/27/2011: I still love the TV and it is working great. I, however, have had it hooked up to the Internet. This is nice for installing updates, and using the few so called Smart Apps the TV comes with. The included Netflix app is a real disappointment, but not a big deal for me. You can only view your saved Netflix que on the TV. The Netflix graphical presentation is a bit last decade as well. Again, it is not a big deal for me because I gain excess to certain web apps through my X-Box and Apple TV. If, however, you are using this TV thinking the Web App experience will be great, you might be disappointed. Also unlike TVs of the past and some LCD TVs friends have, this TVs screen seems to repel dust. The top of the set gathers dust, but the screen always seems to be clean.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant color
Reviews.Author: W. Fiegener
Reviews.Content: So far Im happy with this LCD TV.  Color is incredible. The yellow in the color spectrum really makes a difference.  Its very sleek and very thin.  I dont use the TV's speakers so I cant comment on the sound.  The only negative about this TV is the internet connection.  It only connects to the internet via a Ethernet connection.  I had to spend another $75 on a Ethernet bridge to get it to connect to my wifi.  If your router is next to your TV this isn't a issue but if its in another room you either have to run a long cable or buy a bridge. Why Sharp doesn't offer a wireless connection on these TV's is beyond me.  For the price, it should.  Other then that, I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: This Is One AMAZING Flatscreen!!!!
Reviews.Author: VICB3
Reviews.Content: Can't rave about it enough. I don't know if it's the yellow pixels or what, but everything you throw up on it looks almost three dimensional. Really!Typical Sharp quality that no doubt stems from the fact that they manufacture their own components. (Or so I've been led to believe anyway.) When I first looked at it in a Big Box, I noticed right away that the images seemed brighter and sharper than anything else in the store. Old BW movies look amazing on it.This also gets used as a computer monitor. Consequently, the fact that it has 4 HDMI ports along with everything else is a huge plus. Satellite dish plus blu-ray player plus computer still leaves room for expansion. Has other features I'm still learning about.Do yourself a favor and buy this flatscreen. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture...
Reviews.Author: imconfsdru
Reviews.Content: I reviewed many many TV's before I decided on the Sharp LC40LE810UN 40" 1080p 120Hz LED Edge-lit LCD HDTV But haven't been disappointed! I am an Electronics Sales trainer and am certified for LCD/LED and Plasma technologies by the C.E.A.A.(Consumer Electronics Association of America.) This TV's has by far the best actual picture of any TV within about $2000.00 of it's price range.The Sharp is only a 120hz yet it display's better than my next door neighbors 240hz Vizio is able to and boy does it just feel great everytime someone comes over and says "WOW what kinda TV is that the picture is phenomenal, I feel like I'm standing next to the person looking at them."That being said I did go over all the reviews I could find and aside from 1 negative review about the tv not working and a couple mixed reviews about bad sound quality all I've seen or heard about the Sharp Aquos TV's has been extremely positive and after watching the TV for the last couple months now it has hands down the best picture of any TV I have worked with for any of my position's training in stores like Best Buy, Ultimate Electronics and Wal-Mart to name a few. The sound quality isn't great but what do you expect out of a TV that is no more than 2" thick and if you have trouble hearing the TV it's probably a problem with the TV so have it looked it Sharp will cover it under warranty and they are one of the better companies concerning Customer Support plus the Aquos TV line has a dedicated support staff that works round the clock!! Again and I can't stress this enough you can look and hope to find a better better picture from a plasma, LCD or LED but won't be able to find anything for less than $2500 that has anywhere even close to as good of a picture hands down~!

Reviews.Title: Sharp's Aquos is a Star
Reviews.Author: J. LaGuardia
Reviews.Content: I researched long and hard before buying this TV, and yes, I spent more money than I should have because I could have bought a smaller flat screen with fewer features than the Aquos has.  But I have NOT regretted the purchase one minute.  I did have a few difficulties in the initial setup and hope the following will be helpful to those who have a cable modem and a router on a different floor.  I had to get the cable guy out to bring me a box that would read HD.  After he left, the picture looked really good, but then I decided I had to tie the TV into my WiFi network to use those features.  I called Sharp support, and did not have to wait long at all until someone came on the line.  She said a dongle (sp?) wouldn't work and that my BEST option was to buy a pair of ethernet devices that would plug into the wall (one on each floor) and use the wiring of my house (I was skeptical because we have an old house).  These came with an ethernet cable so that you just plug one into your router and the other into the ethernet port on the back of the Aquos.  Best Buy had them for about $200!  After I plugged them in, they worked fine, but my picture looked degraded to me.  So back on the phone with my cable provider (no help--couldn't understand my problem) and then again with Sharp.Ah.  There was an input button on my remote and once I scrolled down to the correct HDMI port (I thought it was in number two, but it was really in number four!) and clicked, the picture was transformed into something absolutely fantastic!  Netflix streams beautifully and shows that communicate in 480i are all upgraded and look beautiful.As you can tell, I'm ecstatic because I never thought anything could look as good as my Samsung plasma.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, however...
Reviews.Author: LeeVitalone
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the reviews on here, this TV does have a great picture, especially with x box 360 or ps3. However,what a lot of people probably don't notice is that when the screen is totally black, or during a very dark scene in a movie, you can actually see the light from the edge LED's, which can become very annoying. I especially noticed it while playing mario 2 on the NES (played on my PC with VGA, 1920x1080 resolution), with level 1's solid light blue background, the edge LED's are very noticable, especially while the screen is moving, they look like black marks along the edge of the TV when the screen is blue, and while the screen is black they look more white. This is a problem that just about all edge-lit LED tv's have. Also, images don't have quite as much depth as a full array LED set, or even a traditional CCFL LCD tv. Despite these draw backs, it is still a great TV with a great picture, most of the time if your just playing an x box game or watching tv you won't notice the edge LED. To the guy that is certified for LCD/LED and Plasma technologies by the C.E.A.A.(Consumer Electronics Association of America)... that must not mean very much if you didn't know that edge LED offers less picture depth than a traditional LCD tv and more picture anamolies. Also the 120hz refresh rate is nice, but most of the time it is better when turned off. While playing x box 360 it offers no noticable improvment with the 120hz, infact it actually makes the screen flicker when the camera is turned, since no 360 games run at more than 60 frames per second anyway. Also with movies, they are recorded at 24 frames per second (24hz) so turning the 120hz on during a movie actually makes motion look worse. Although, it is nice to have the option to use 120hz if you want or need it, but it really is not needed at all. This TV can also display at 70 or 75 hz through a pc connnection. Despite all it's problems, for the price, I am satisfied with this unit. I just thought anyone who plans on getting san edge-lit unit should know about their problems, go for a full array if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: As Good As It Gets
Reviews.Author: carolann1222
Reviews.Content: First, I will say that we have had somewhat of a brand loyalty to Sharp over the years (not exclusively, but to us its very favorable).  Took our time and did a lot of shopping around in stores and online, comparing models, prices, features.  Came up with a few different brand finalists and ultimately chose this Sharp Quattron model.  ***WHAT A TV*** !!  Picture is astounding, sound is excellent - built in subwoofer helps I'm sure, set-up is simple, other features and Netflix are great.  I'm sure an additional sound system or soundbar would make it even better, but right now we don't see the need.  Went with Amazon because of the price, financing, return policy (just in case), and free shipping so we wouldn't have to lug it from the big box store into the house.  Didn't want anything too too expensive, or 3D, or other bells and whistles - just an amazing TV, and we got it with the Sharp Quattron.  Thanks, Amazon, for making it easy.

Reviews.Title: Very good tv but no A/V
Reviews.Author: Cody
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV brand new from a small town shop for 1200 back in sep of 2011, (i know i could of got it for cheaper but i like to support small local shops) i came from a 2009 model mitsubishi dlp WD 60737  and i love the difference huge upgrade from the dlp.i mainly use this tv for gaming on my xbox 360, and the games look really good. Battlefield 3 and Skyrim look really good on this tv, and playing Madden and other fast moving games is good, i have not seen any lag or ghosting at all in this TV.upscale dvds from my xbox look good cant complain (not blu ray)Sound is ok but tvs arnt built for great sound that is why they make surround sound systemsmy only CON about this tv would be there is no A/V ports for my Dreamcast BUT it does have a VGA so im going out and buying a vga cord for my dreamcast, but still... what tv does not have a A/V port.... you will be mad if you have a ps1 or ps2 or gamecube and xbox 1. you have to go out and buy component cords for your systems OR buy the special 3.5MM headphone to a/V cord which is like 2 or 3$ online but dont go thru sharp to buy the cord they were gonna charge me 24.99$ for the damn thingif the tv had A/V ports then i would of gave the tv a 5/5 stars. love the picture, and the frame of the tv. if you have the extra $$ go with the 50inch i wish i would of spent the extra $$$ and got the 50inch model

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Laurence Baume "ellbee"
Reviews.Content: I've had my Sharp LC40LE910UN 40" HDTV for two weeks now, and am still amazed at the quality of the color picture in all sorts of room lighting, from high bright daytime to darker night time.  I have not noticed any fading to grey or lack of great blacks at all.  I love the OPC automatic picture control for adjusting the set to the room light. It works perfectly.  Set up was a breeze, and hooking up a DVD-BluRay player took 5 seconds.  The remote is easy to use after you get used to the buttons, but that doesn't take long at all, and it even works with my FIOS set top box too.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this HDTV:  the price is right, the color and picture are great, and hooking it up is no mystery at all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture - poor build quality
Reviews.Author: Robert Keith
Reviews.Content: Firstly - the picture is the best I have seen in a TV of this class. By far.I bought this TV in April 2011. It was new in a sealed box. Immediately I set it up on its stand I noticed that it rattled during low pitched sounds. A few weeks later I hung it on a wall bracket. As I was removing the stand, two screws fell out of the back. I tried to put them back and they would not stay in.I checked all of the screws around the edges at the back. They had all been over-tightened and would not hold. This resulted in the back distorting and rattling. It indicates that Sharp's Mexican assembly plant has serious quality issues.Returning it under warranty would have been too much fuss so I fixed the problem with some slightly larger screws.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Techie
Reviews.Content: The quality of the unit and the picture is very good.  The only complaint that I have is the sound quality.  The sound does not appear loud enough and no matter which setting I select the sound is lacking richness.  On the other hand the picture is extremely good and it gives a 3D appearance.  The auto-setup is very easy and quick. Overall I would recommend the product

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: bcbaxter10
Reviews.Content: This is the best tv we have ever purchased. We have Aquos tv's in every room, but this is by far the best picture quality we have ever seen.Even regular definition is amazing. The price was really good, and there have been no issues whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: I did not expect it to be this great...
Reviews.Author: William E. Schroeter "WS"
Reviews.Content: To be perfectly honest, I am surprised by how well this purchase worked out. The picture is stupendous. Visitors offer unsolicited compliments on how real programs look. The only gripe I have is that there seems to be a slight lag when interfacing with the cable-provided DVR menus. Perhaps it is my setup (or the cable box), I have not been bothered enough by it to troubleshoot.

Reviews.Title: Picture looks so real it almost looks fake!!
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing TV! I picked mine up at best buy open box for $699. When I was at the store I wasn't there looking to walk out with a TV, I was just kind of browsing around (was more in the market for a new laptop) but when I have had my eye on the sharp TV's for quite some time now as I have always thought they have a much better picture than any of the other TV's out there. When I saw this one open box for $799 I just had to ask someone if that was the best price they could do. When the sales guy came back and told me $699 I wasn't about to walk out of the store without it!! Brought it home, hooked it up and the picture is amazing!! When your watching a blu-ray the picture looks so real, like your sitting right there. It looks so real it almost looks fake!!! Your brain is going "this can't be real, I've never seen anything look this good coming off a TV screen"Sound quality isn't the greatest I have ever heard but its not horrible either.Overall very VERY nice TV and i would highly recommend it to ANYONE!!!

Reviews.Title: One of the best values around
Reviews.Author: Tmoney
Reviews.Content: This TV is incredible.  4,000,000 : 1 contrast ratio and it is overwhelmingly apparent.  Video games are amazing, the sound is great also.  I see all of these Samsung HDTV's that have bulb problems, my previous 2 Samsung's all had to have the light replaced.  I have owned a VIZIO and an LG.  None of them are even close to the quality of SHARP.  SHARP is in a league of their own, and its not even close.  I will never buy a different brand of television for as long as I live.  This was a steal, I got it for 750, 1200 off the retail price from going through Amazon, and if any are still available, I urge anyone and everyone to buy them up while they can.  I see so many people reading consumer reports and reading reviews and not realizing many of these online organizations are paid by these companies to promote their product.  Try and find a negative review of any SHARP product on the market.  I urge you too...you won't find any, because they don't exist.  SHARP may not market like others, but they don't have too, because no one has anything bad to say about their products.  The really intelligent buyers who really do their homework and think subjectively go with SHARP.  Samsung, Sony, Panasonic, LG, VIZIO, are all nice brands, but the clarity, and the picture don't come close to SHARP.  Their company name is truly what you get on the screen.  I hope more people don't find about SHARP TV's so I can keep paying VIZIO prices for the best products on the market since SHARP should be charging double what SONY is.  They are the Jordan of the TV world, and we are getting them at the Steve Kerr Price.

Reviews.Title: Sound broken when arrived....once repaired, GREAT
Reviews.Author: bhar
Reviews.Content: The Sharpe TV arrived quickly along with the additional items I ordered.  Unfortunatly the Sound Board was bad.  The local repair company Sharp used was VERY POOR, and it was 2 weeks until it was working.  SHARP was wonderful in trying to solve our problem and offered several solutions, all ended up taking the extended lenghth of time.  They also extended our warranty free of charge for six months for our inconvenience.  Good Company.  Hope the TV continues to work as promised.They were unsatisfied with the local company as well.One the tv was repaired, it works like a champ.  Great Picture.

Reviews.Title: Incredible TV, Great Vendor
Reviews.Author: faredv
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible television.  The 4th color adds a depth dimension to every image displayed - older movies as well as new HD - that almost gives you a 3D effect without the glasses.  I was concerned that I would have to add external amplifier and speakers, but the sound quality it exceptional as well.  I also would recommend this vendor.  The product was shipped the same day of my order, and the box was received in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Panama "Panama"
Reviews.Content: Great color, great picture.  I now have seven Sharps, 5 32, 1 37 and 1 40.  Not one problem.  This is tee best so far.  Only drawback would be the screen is reflective on this modle.  No problem for me.

Reviews.Title: Solidly Built TV
Reviews.Author: Rob Wille
Reviews.Content: The Sharp TV appears to be solidly built and the speakers are more than adequate even for large rooms. The set also looks very "sharp" and looks good even when it is not on. I am happy with and would recommend this product."The reviewer was compensated for posting this review. However, the opinion stated in the review is that of the reviewer and the reviewer alone. Further, the reviewer independently selected this product to review and has no affiliation with the product maker/distributor, Amazon or the review requester"

Reviews.Title: AQUOS BEAUTY
Reviews.Author: Bode
Reviews.Content: This TV is just fantastic, it surprised me in every way, the image is shocking. It worked perfectly right out of the box. Instructions and set up were easy. Netflix was used on that same night. I ordered HDMI and Ethernet cables with the TV, so everything was running right the way. Perfect, no problems at all; TV was delivered in 3 days. I am very happy with the product. Money well spent. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Best choice I've made
Reviews.Author: M. Hager "Texas Fan"
Reviews.Content: Sharp has outdone itself with the new Aquos. I don't know if it's the addition of yellow to the color palette or just improvements in HD broadcast technology, but twice last night during network shows (a rerun of Law and Order and a rerun of Glee) I had to check to see if they had been taped "live". The picture quality was that good. This TV replaced a 32-inch Sharp Aquos (that was about five years old and doing fine). In my apartment living room, 40 inches is about the max (and maybe just a little too large) but I'm telling you, this is the TV.

Reviews.Title: This TV is not worth the money.
Reviews.Author: Margaret Ludlow
Reviews.Content: This Television only lasted 2 years and 3 months.For the price we paid, I think it should have lasted a lot longer.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad TV.
Reviews.Author: J. Lowrey
Reviews.Content: Bought it refurbished for a great price and with warranty coverage and I'm satisfied with the purchase.Pros:Lots of inputs and options.Good brightness controls.Nice sharp image, even when upscalling from 720p.Had no issue getting it online to pull a firmware update over the Internet (and then promptly disconnected it again).Cons:The dynamic brightness/contrast/whatever feature was pretty horrible on mine. It would make very obvious changes randomly during shows and movies and usually made the image look worse with odd color biases. Thankfully you can disable that feature.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Rita Brand "Rita Brand"
Reviews.Content: Actually, I did a lot of my research from the comments on this site! It was a great price and the picture is fabulous! My husband still comments on what a great pick I made! The people look so real, it's amazing!

Reviews.Title: This was an amazing purchase
Reviews.Author: jerzyguy
Reviews.Content: I read reviews of other HDTV companies and decided on this Sharp Aquos 40 inch.  First, it was easy to set up. The base fit as directed. and had no issues.  Connections were also easy.  I connected first into cable, then into internet and third into my DVD player.  The picture is amazing. unlike complaints about other companies, the Netflix connection was simple and has no problems at all. I got rid of my Roku box and now can control my connections through the TV handset.  The HDMI cable (noticed complaints about the amazon cable so bought the Media Bridge ultra series cable) the colors and control are perfect with all areas.  The sound alone was very good.  I will consider a home theater sound in the future.There also is support through Aquos both online and via phone which was helpful and courteous.  I highly recommend this product.  I received a great price for a great product.

Reviews.Title: Really Sharp!
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Pappas "Retired"
Reviews.Content: Ihave had this for a while and it really does what it says. Great colors and Aquos is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Most impressive TV I have ever owned or seen
Reviews.Author: Nuclear Dad
Reviews.Content: I purchased one, then I had to purchase another.  The four LED technology makes a HUGE difference.  The network interface capabilities are impressive, the ability to update the TV and connect it over the Web are innovative and well put together.  I have now started buying all of the Sharp Aquos compatible equipment.  Lots of easy to use interfaces.Bottom line, all of the gadgets aside, the image drives me to buy...

Reviews.Title: Sharp 40 Quattron, I'd give it 6 stars if I could
Reviews.Author: L. Cuomo "Cookbook Collector"
Reviews.Content: I've owned the Sharp 40" Quattron since last May. It was incredibly easy to set up and adjust the picture to my liking, and very easy to use. I've attached everything that could be attached to it (except a gaming console as I'm not a gamer) and it works beautifully. The picture is so crisp and the color so true it's almost 3D. Because the picture is so outstanding, I've become an avid Blu-Ray DVD watcher. I like the internet access to the Blu-Ray extras. I use the Aquos Net when I don't feel like turning on my computer. I like the Screen Dreams that displays HD photo slide shows, nice if the TV is wall mounted and you don't want to see a big black screen all the time. You can also plug in a USB stick to watch your own personal slide shows or listen to your music.The Aquos Advantage is a great personalized service if you have questions or problems with your Aquos TV and want to speak to a real live person. In this sense, Sharp's customer service is excellent.The TV goes easy on my electric bill and generates virtually no heat when turned on. The sound is good, but I purchased a Sharp Sound Bar to enhance the performance.I am thoroughly satisfied with the Sharp Quattron and highly recommend it to anyone who wants to invest in a great HD TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Zz Norton
Reviews.Content: TV quality is great. Colors are great. Only issue is that you cannot search the web at will, there are only a few sites that you can access.

Reviews.Title: The Best TV I Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Jamie Bishop
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv about a month ago and let me tell you,this is the best tv I have ever owned.The picture on this tv is amazing and audio quality is just as good.The picture is unbelievably lifelike,words can't describe it.The audio quality is second to none.I definately recomend this tv to anyone looking for a flat screen.

Reviews.Title: Worked great right out of the box
Reviews.Author: S. Friedland
Reviews.Content: The TV was quickly taken out of the box, the base attached easily and, once plugged in, worked like a charm. Colors were vivid and beautiful, sound quality superb. We still had to use both the TV remote that came with it and the remote from the cable company to work the set. I thing getting a universal remote will solve that problem. The whole family is happy with it. While we were able to find the set a bit cheaper elsewhere, the fact that this included free shipping and no tax made the purchase from Amazon the overall cheapest way to go.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality!
Reviews.Author: KendoGuy
Reviews.Content: I haven't found that much not to like about this set. Sure the sound isn't great, but that's par for the course with flatscreens. I was very pleased to find a 3.5mm audio out jack for my wireless headphones ( I don't think it's mentioned in the description ). The remote is kinda lackluster - wish it had bigger audio/channel buttons. Other than that, it's a great set.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: scf
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV today.  The resolution and the colours are astounding.  I love it.  It's an amazing value.

Reviews.Title: Aquos New Technology
Reviews.Author: Glenn McGeough
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV. It is an extremely stylish monitor being slim with silver/chrome surrounding the monitor. The picture is amazing and the sound is competitive with other 40 inch TV's.  I run in HD and the picture is competitive with a Sony costing 3X the price. The colors are rich and bold. I honestly don't see any difference in a 4 color spectrum over 3 color, but again the picture is crystal clear with bright vibrant colors. I also like the automatic picture adjustment to the light in the room. A few things that I might improve is picture in a picture which is not available. Also, the time it takes for startup seems a bit long. However, I would give this TV top rating and I would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Almost a five star but alas....
Reviews.Author: Jobu
Reviews.Content: I now own 4 Sharp LCD TVs.  This is after years of consecutive Sony purchases - and for record, they were all awesome.  I switched to Sharp for the price/value ratio which I thought was better.  The one thing I do not like about this TV is that unlike my prior TVs, this one doesn't work well with my Comcast remote.  Before I had that one remote able to turn on, off or control volume (including mute) and channels.  I have the other remotes but no real need for them.  On this I am stuck with two remontes.  If someone actually knows how to solve this, please tell.  It is kind of annoying right now.

Reviews.Title: bad product
Reviews.Author: al
Reviews.Content: too much yellow on picture from factory preset , have a fuzzy sound when the tv has been using for 3 hours up . I'm so disappointed that i bought this product.

Reviews.Title: Good but...
Reviews.Author: john vincennes
Reviews.Content: Everything about the screen is good except for the sound. No matter how loud you make it, it is still hard to understand some speech. Its like teh speakers are mounted in teh back or something.  Its really hard to figure out.  I had to turn up the bass treble and mids to compensate-- and its still not very good.  Its really too bad because at the store you're looking at pic quality and assume the sound will be fine.  So we must now get a sound system. Dammit!!
